subject: Management
title: Learning Culture
description: A short lesson to help you apply Learning Culture.

hook.text: Toyota's factory workers stop the production line when they spot a defect. Any worker. Any time.

buildup.text: Learning cultures treat every problem as a chance to improve the system, not blame a person.

discovery.text: Peter Senge's learning organization: teams that continuously reflect, experiment, and share knowledge.

twist.text: Most organizations punish errors. Learning organizations study them. The difference compounds over years.

climax.text: Run blameless post-mortems. Share lessons openly. Reward people who surface problems early.

punchline.text: The organization that learns fastest wins.

quiz.question: What defines a learning organization?
options: It treats problems as improvement opportunities and shares lessons openly
It sends employees to the most training courses each year
It hires only people who already have all needed skills
